result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Mark Danielson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#1 in 15CM96. Per Wis. Stat 968.075(1)(a) 3 years probation

miscConds.notes: Agent to look at an AODA and a domestic abuse assessment for batters'.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Mark Danielson

records.addlTxt: 12:08 PM Defendant Daniel Mark Danielson in court.   Court - All  obligations have been paid.  12:09 p.m.
Defendant's Notice of Hearing. Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as addressed.
Probation review hearing on January 14, 2019 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:16 Defendant Daniel Mark Danielson in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM96 heard at this time. OSullivan; guilty to Ct#1 in 15CM74 and 15CM96. Dismiss Ct#2 in each case. 3 years probation conditions per Wis Stat. 968.075(1)(a) ; court costs and DNA surcharge and absolute sobriety. Atty Weber and Def agree to probation.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to Ct#1 in 15CM73 and Ct#1 in 15CM96; Weber stipulates to a factual basis.  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. Court finds and adjudicates Def guilty of Ct#1 in 15CM73 acknowledged to be domestic abused based it was commited to an adult person residing with the Defendant 968.075(1)(a); and Ct#2 in 15CM96. Dismiss Ct#2 in 15CM73 and 15CM96. OSullivan and Weber address sentencing. Victim addresses the Court.  Court: S/W 3 years probation on Ct#1 15CM73 and Ct#1 15CM96; concurrent. conditions: court costs and DNA surcharge. Agent to look at AODA and a domestic abuse assessment for batters'.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Def to make attorney fee payments at $50/month

Final pre-trial at 01-25-2016 02:00 pm.
Jury trial at 02-11-2016 08:30 am.

4:14  15CM96 is included in this hearingDefendant Daniel Mark Danielson in court with attorney Julie A. Weber.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No agreement has been reached.  ATtys requests jury trial. Court will set for jury and FPT  Issued criminal scheduling order.
Defendant's for Discovery and Inspection filed by Atty Weber

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 3:39 Defendant Daniel Mark Danielson in court.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Chris Bub appeared in court with Def. Thorie requests warrant be quashed. Court quashes warrant. Atty Bub addresses missed court date. Thorie requests the signature bond be reinstated. Court: reinstates signature bond. Bub states the Def is trying to retain his own counsel.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Court goes over bond conditions.
Address is correct. 715-441-4844 cell phone.
Birth date is correct.

3:33 Defendant Daniel Mark Danielson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant Daniel Mark Danielson in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges, maximum penalties and charging portion of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court enters in not guilty plea. OSullivan: $1000 signature bond with absolute sobriety. Nelson: no objection to signature bond requests no abusive contact. Defendant Daniel Mark Danielson in court with attorney . Def does not qualify for the PD. Def is not a veteran.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
